title: Chief Accountant
skill: Accounting Software, Balance Sheet Review, Balance Sheets, Bank Statements, Cash Flow, Costings, Financial Accounting, Management Accounting, P&L Management, and Prepayment Processing
aboutthejob:
Chief Accountant-Job description

1/ Receive handover from accounting service company.

2/ Set up more functions for the production company (bags/backpacks...). Set up and manage accounting Dept. Monitoring implementation of financial accounting system in accordance with the VAS and other current laws.

3/ Check invoices/supporting docs to prepare payment. Check bank statements and cash daily.

4/ Prepare VAT reports, PIT, CIT quarterly and finalization.

5/ Check assets/prepayment & and prepare depreciation reports

6/ Prepare and check salary.

7/ Manage and control stock with other departments check monthly/quarterly and yearly.

8/ Make FS reports: Trial balance, Balance sheet, P&L and Cash Flow monthly/quarterly/yearly.

9/ Internal management reports as BOD requested.

10/ Work with Tax Dept/External Auditors /Other administration.

11/ Work with other departments to get smooth workflow.

12/ Other jobs assigned by Board of Director

Prefer:

- Candidate has experience in bags/backpacks/garment,..

- Good in English

- Has a chief accountant certificate

Employment Type Full-time

Contact: Ms. Phuong-IRIS (0961600950, hr@ffg-limited.com)/

Thuy (0906350859, thuy@ffg-limited.com)

FFG VIETNAM COMPANY LIMITED

Add: Lot CN-1, Agtex Long Binh Industrial Zone, Long Binh Ward, Bien Hoa City, Dong Nai Province, Vietnam. Mobile Tel: 02513.683.440

Location:  https://maps.app.goo.gl/RvSTNZh8Jq17xwvk7

title: Warehouse Admin - Shopee Xpress, Sorting Centre
skill: Defining Requirements, Job Description Development, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Office, VBA Excel, and Working Experience
aboutthejob:
Job Description


  • Prepare and complete orders for delivery or pickup according to schedule (load, pack, wrap, label, ship)
  • Maintain accurate records of products that have been stocked and provide management with an accurate representation of all goods shipped and received
  • Verify all incoming shipments to be accurate by comparing the received number to the order and ensure all goods are in excellent condition
  • Ensure the inventory is controlled and maintained with high quality for the purpose of audits.
  • Identify any missing, lost or damaged materials and immediately notify the supervisor.
  • Ensure that all the merchandise is safely and securely packed and labeled for delivery.
  • Scan labels to ensure products are shipped to the right destination.
  • Accurately maintain company database including all stock and warehouse items on the system
  • Support Operations in maintaining & repairing tools, and equipment at Hub/SOC
  • Follow quality service standards and comply with procedures, rules, and regulations
  • Keep the company quality policies in mind while working.


Requirements


  • Have 2-3 years of experience in the field of Warehouse Keeper with the job descriptions above
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail
  • Have proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and inventory systems
  • Excellent organizational, time management, and multitasking skills.
  • Willing to work from Monday to Saturday

title: Demi Chef (Vietnamese candidate only)
skill: Attention to Detail, Cleansing, Culinary Arts, Hotel Management, Hygiene, Interpersonal Skills, Meat, Operational Excellence, Sanitation, and Vietnamese
aboutthejob:
Company Description

Contemporary, relaxed and imaginative. Be it a leisurely family break or romantic escape, AVANI Hotels & Resorts provides the right space for guests who value the details that matter.

Job Description

As Demi Chef you will help the Executive Chef to prepare appetizers, as well as meat and vegetables for entrees. You further will help with the proper presentation of food, and ensure that that each customer is served the highest quality food in a timely manner. As Demi Chef you will participate in selecting and training new members of the kitchen team. They must follow and enforce health and safety standards in the kitchen. They should possess a high level of cleanliness, both in the kitchen and in personal hygiene. You should be familiar with working efficiently and quickly under pressure.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree or any culinary degree
  • Must have worked at least one year as Demi Chef in Hotels and Restaurants
  • Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills
  • Strongly committed to teamwork and customer service
  • Eye for detail to achieve operation excellence

title: Rider Experience Lead - Customer Excellence & Admin, Shopee Xpress
skill: Complaint Management, Defining Requirements, Key Performance Indicators, Product Complaints, Quality Assurance, Regulatory Requirements, Root Cause, Root Cause Analysis, and Service Improvement
aboutthejob:
Job Description


  • Take charge for performance and capability of team members in responsible area
  • Lead & manage communication plans for riders when the policy changes.
  • Lead and execute engagement strategies, prioritizing the right projects to meet riders’ needs.
  • Analyze KPIs, identify fraudulent behaviors, and propose process and service improvements
  • Maintain complaint and nonconformance processing, investigate product complaints or quality issues, and develop complaint and inspection procedures
  • Propose process and service improvement suggestions related to Riders by identifying Rider's pain-points and provide suggestions to simplify processes and optimize performance.
  • Motivate, coach team members and ensure their KPIs are achieved; Work closely with team leads and develop Rider’s quality through ongoing coaching, mentoring and career discussions.
  • Lead and manage other ad-hoc projects assigned by the Leadership.


Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree in economics, Finance, Accounting or related fields.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience in operations management or similar role
  • Experience managing teams and leading day-to-day operations.
  • Experience in quality assurance, complaint handling, and root cause analysis.
  • Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to rider operations and quality control.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively manage communication plans for riders and work with team members, management, and external stakeholders.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to identify trends and propose solutions to improve rider experience and prevent fraudulent behavior.
  • Ability to work independently and take ownership of projects while also being a team player and collaborating effectively with others.
  • Able to drive and implement ideas to present findings in a fast-paced environment.
  • High sense of responsibility, careful, eager to learn, integrity.

title: N2/N1 Japanese Business Operations Staff (in Da Nang)
location: Da Nang, Da Nang City, Vietnam (Hybrid)
skill: Critical Thinking, Defining Requirements, English, English to Japanese, Japanese, Logics, Performance Motivation, Teamwork, and Writing
aboutthejob:
We’re Hitachi Digital Services, a global digital solutions and transformation business. Our expertise, innovation and technology unlocks potential – from taking theme park fans on magical rides, conserving natural resources, protecting rainforests, and saving lives. We automate, modernize, optimize, and accelerate. Our people are trusted transformers, with deep engineering expertise, focused on a sustainable future for all.

Imagine the sheer breadth of talent it takes to inspire the future. We don’t expect you to ‘fit’ every requirement – your life experience, character, perspective, and passion for achieving great things in the world are equally important to us.

The role

The Japanese Business Operations Staff who will work closely with Project Manager to monitor and provide Business operation support service to Japanese clients. The position involves daily communication with Japanese client to handle various kinds of service requests such as Call center service (Query handling), Operation service (data registration/system integration), Troubleshooting (data investigation, error handling), etc.

In addition, this role involves handling service requests of the assigned service following the agreed SLA (Service Level Agreement) and being responsible for translation all kinds of work-related IT or non-IT documents from English to Japanese and vice versa.

What You’ll Bring
  • Japanese level: N1/N2 or equivalent (especially speaking and writing skills).
  • English level: TOEIC 600+ or equivalent (writing and reading skills).
  • Good understanding of Japanese's working culture, Japanese's business manner.
  • Ability to collaborate and work in a cross-functional/multi-national team environment, work directly to client for analyse and collect requirements.
  • Effective use of MS office, have knowledge of Workday HCM or Business Process Outsourcing systems is a plus.
  • Self-motivated and eager to learn, good at logical thinking and analysis and high responsibility and teamwork spirit.

Championing diversity, equity, and inclusion

Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.

How We Look After You

We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).

About Us

We’re a global team of innovators, together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for creating meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into industry leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society.

We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.

title: Buyer Leader (Chinese Speaking)
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam (On-site)
skill: Analytical Skills, Chinese, Communication, English, Entrepreneurship, Key Performance Indicators, Mandarin, Merchandising, Negotiation, and Project Management
aboutthejob:
Job Purpose

The Buyer Leader is responsible for supervising a team of buyers through all purchasing functions, managing day-to-day activities, developing, and supporting the team projects related to process & system improvements. The lead buyer is accountable for all products managed by their team, on-time delivery, cost, data integrity, and cross-functional process handoffs.


Leading the strategic and operational activities:

  • Ensure the portfolio of suppliers is managed by the buyer(s) in compliance with supplier agreements, product quality, and production metrics.
  • Onboarding new supplier assortments on a monthly basis
  • Build effective communication and collaborate closely cross-functionally with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Maintain the product and supplier catalog database.
  • Review the accuracy and existence of backup documentation files and maintaining a good filing system in accordance with the company policies and standard procedures.
  • Conduct regular evaluations of supplier options according to prices, quality etc. and ensure collaborative relationships including identification of opportunities for cost savings.
  • Discover and purchase new products and check the quality and popularity of those already on our shelves


Team Management:

  • Manage and develop a team of buyers through training & coaching
  • Oversee the day-to-day purchasing activities (Orders, Payments, Shipping documents).
  • Serve as backup to the buyer(s) including creating, reviewing, processing, and issuing orders with suppliers.
  • Identify and lead process improvement activities.


What you bring to the table:

  • 5+ years of related experience with strong management performance
  • 10+ years merchandising / buying experience, ecommerce experience is a plus
  • Excellent communication skills - interpersonal, written and verbal in both English and Mandarin
  • A good understanding of the market supplier pricing and with strong negotiation skills.
  • Exhibits impactful communication with peers up to LT level
  • Maintain a strong team efficiency, build processes, monitor and adjust all buyer group KPI metrics on ‘Month to Month’ basis.
  • Vertical retail experience required with a strong analytical skill, including the ability to interpret multiple data points across numerous channels and market segments
  • Proven ability to work with and lead a cross functional team
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously; Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives and take on more responsibility
  • Entrepreneurship – an ability to make decisions and take calculated risks
  • Good at Chinese & English communication

title: HR Manager ( 8 month temp role)
skill: Analytical Skills, Communication, Compensation, Compensation & Benefits, Employee Relations, Human Resources (HR), Interpersonal Skills, Labor and Employment Law, Organizational Talent, Policies & Procedures, Project Management, and Talent Assessment
aboutthejob:
Human Resource Manager, Your future position?

You will report to the HR Manager of Indochina, this role will be responsible for the operational HR function and implementation of Givaudan’s HR strategy to the specific demands in Operations Vietnam. This would be a 8 months contract role.


Core Responsibilities

  • Provide employee relations advice to managers and employees on HR matters.
  • Provide interpretation and guidance on human resources policies and employment law.
  • Develop and implement human resource strategies and programmes associated with accomplishing business objectives.
  • Manage complex employee relations issues and ensures key HR business processes are implemented effectively.
  • Lead, participates in or supports the implementation of corporate and site initiatives or projects
  • Provide on-site compensation and benefit consultation and administration including annual merit and incentive cycles, performance appraisals, and benefits inquiries. Ensure fair and competitive positioning of salaries through internal equity and external market analysis
  • Responsible for Global HR processes (Annual Compensation Review, Performance management, Talent & Succession planning)

You?

Are you someone who wants to grow and shape your own world? Who needs a new challenge and bring excellent contribution to the company? Then come and join us and impact your world.

Your professional profile includes:

  • This will be a 8 months contract role.
  • University degree in Human Resources or related field is preferred.
  • 5-7 years' experience in HR Resources, preferably with international organizations.
  • Strong commercial mind-set / business acumen and able to drive continuous improvement.
  • Experience with HR Processes, Practices and Policies, dealing with Trade Union.
  • Understanding of Employment Law.
  • Strong Interpersonal Skills: ability to approach, engage and motivate people from all backgrounds.
  • Analytical skills: ability to use relevant information, data and reports to recommend policy and process solutions to address risks and opportunities and align with HR strategy and plans.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills.
  • Project Management experience.
  • HR Business Partnering exposure.

Required Functional & Technical Skills

Business Acumen

  • Acts with a commercial mindset and sound point of view on the organisation and what could drive continuous improvement.

HR Processes, Practices and Policies

  • Develops and applies people processes and strategies within local context in order to grow the business.

Employment Law

  • Supports and coaches managers to understand and comply with relevant legislation and employee relation policies and practices.

Employee Relations

  • Provides conflict or employee relations advice confidently based on sound understanding of organisation’s policy and practice, and a judgement based on context and personal opinion.

Analytical Skills

  • Uses relevant information, data and reports to recommend policy and process solutions to address risks and opportunities and align with HR strategy and plans.

Communication Skills

  • Tailors verbal and written communications to appeal to, include and engage different audiences.

Project Management

  • Applies the basics of project management tools and approaches.

HR Business Partnering

  • Supports managers with reactive talent management solutions.

title: Footwear Tooling Engineer
skill: Computer-Aided Design (CAD), English, Footwear, Mold, Molding (Process), PDF Creator, Problem Solving, Rhino 3D, and Tooling Design
aboutthejob:
In short

An opportunity to become part of the worlds’ fastest growing sports company has just become available in Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh Office. As a Tooling Engineer, you are responsible for managing the tooling engineering activities for the next-level On’s products, and contributing to material innovation, product commercialisation as well as on time deliveries of samples and productions. As an important member of Product Creation team, you will be based in Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh with frequent travel within Asia.

Your Mission

  • Manage tooling engineering for the next-level of On’s products, including inline-range product creation as well as innovation of future concepts
  • Well-integrate sole material innovation in the engineering of tooling creation
  • Responsible for the accuracy and aesthetic of sole and other tooling modelings, with On’s technical partners (shoe factory tooling team, mold shops,etc.)
  • Lead sole grading to enhance consistency of full sizes running experience with consideration of various weights
  • Lead sole process commercialisation, to ensure efficiency of sole production as well as technical elements is well respected in the final products
  • Oversee tooling development and commercialisation timeline, and ensure on time deliveries
  • Live and share our commitment to sustainability and quality and drive initiatives that set On apart from all other brands


Your story

  • At least 5 years' experience in molding and tooling for footwear
  • Extensive knowledge of the molding process, molding equipment, molding materials and mold tooling
  • Experience with CAD (2D/3D)
  • Ability to work independently under a deadline and simultaneously on several projects which require both innovative ideas and engineering problem-solving
  • Good communication & collaboration skills are a plus
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken). Mandarin is a plus


About The Team

On Footwear Development team is responsible for On full footwear product development process and is defined by out-of-the-box thinking and the outstanding athlete-informed technology that differentiates On footwear from all other footwear products in the market. By joining the On Footwear Development Team, you will have the opportunity to be part of an agile and interdisciplinary team of experts in the areas of footwear engineering and product management.

Most lived Spirit in our team

On is a place that is centered around growth and progress. We offer an environment designed to give people the tools to develop holistically – to stay active, to learn, explore and innovate. Our distinctive approach combines a supportive, team-oriented atmosphere, with access to personal self-care for both physical and mental well-being, so each person is led by purpose. On is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair and inclusive, where all decisions related to recruitment, advancement, and retention are free of discrimination.

title: Biology/Agriculture Intern
skill: Biology, Data Collection, Ecology, English, Field Research, Knowledge Acquisition, Observation, Research Skills, Skill Development, and Vietnamese
aboutthejob:
Are you passionate about food, greenhouses and optimizing growth processes? Do you want to work with top-notch technology to provide clean and healthy food in a developing country? Do you want to work in an international company?


If so, we have an exciting internship opportunity for you. Join Royal HaskoningDHV Vietnam to contribute to the development of sustainable food production. You will have the opportunity to develop your research skills, gain expertise while contributing to a meaningful project. Take this chance and let’s enhance society together!


What will you do?


During a period of 4 months, you will prepare your research plan, collect data on a newly developed and constructed greenhouse in Long An (Vietnam) and write your research (probably Ho Chi Minh City). You will collaborate with our client’s team to gather data. You are expected to handle the investigation on your own, guided by the technical and horticultural expertise of our client’s team.


Your duties also include:


  • Harvest and record yield of individual plants;
  • Take camera images to assess growth of plants;
  • Use thermal camera images to assess plant stress;
  • Collect soil, air quality and other environmental data;
  • Analyse all data;
  • Record observation regarding plant growth or health;
  • Other tasks as reasonably assigned by your direct supervisors.


What you bring


  • Final year student in the field of ecology / biology / biotechnology or other related fields;
  • Be able to intern full time for at least 4 months;
  • Willingness to travel between sites and offices;
  • Experience with data gathering and field research, preferably in Greenhouses;
  • Experience with database management;
  • Passion for plants and agriculture, and ability to handle inclement weather including buggy conditions and hot and wet weather;
  • Fluent in both English and Vietnamese;
  • Curiosity to learn about international companies operating in Vietnam.


Where you will work


Active in Vietnam since 1985 and established in 1993, HaskoningDHV Vietnam is a 100% foreign invested company of Royal HaskoningDHV and recognized as one of the most prominent leading engineering and consultancy firms with a unique track record of key projects in Vietnam and SE Asia. With offices in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi and nearly 200 employees, HaskoningDHV Vietnam has carried out numerous projects for the private and public sector, comprising the full scope of engineering and consultancy services for Industrial projects, Maritime & Waterways, Water Management and Real Estate projects.


What do we offer?


We are a professional organization with appealing (inter)national projects and products. You will be working with experts who are leaders across different business lines. We also offer you:


  • Attractive allowance package;
  • Expenses paid for housing in Long An, travel to site from HCMC by public transportation;
  • Opportunities to join the transition to deliver clean food to a growing population;
  • Opportunities to discover the top-knowledge technology in the food producing industry;
  • Understanding horticulture: Learn about nutrient and environmental requirements, transplanting, diagnosing, and treating pests and diseases organically, and propagation;
  • Experience day-to-day operations in a fast-growing greenhouse start-up;
  • A unique experience to work with an international company.


This internship is open to VN students who is currently based in Vietnam.


Are you our new intern?


Are you interested? Then we would like to meet you! Apply now by sending in your English CV using the button below.

title: 【ソニー・ホンダモビリティ（株）】In-car／Out-car(車内外)サイバーセキュリティ
location: District 9, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
aboutthejob:
職務内容

========================

リモート面接を実施中です

========================

【採用の背景】

ソニー・ホンダモビリティは、2022年9月に設立されたHondaとソニーのジョイント・ベンチャーです。私たちは、オープンな職場環境や文化を築き、あらゆる知見や、最先端の技術と豊かな感性を掛け合わせて、新たな移動の感動を創造していきたいと考えています。

そのため、「多様な知で革新を追求し、人を動かす」という私たちのPurposeや取り組みに共感し、創業期を共にする世界中の才能と意欲のある仲間を探しています。

※本組織のメンバーは、本田技研工業株式会社雇用で、ソニー・ホンダモビリティ株式会社出向となります。

※ソニー・ホンダモビリティ（株）についての情報は 【こちら】

【組織の役割】

サイバーセキュリティ施策の立案、実行推進

【職務内容】

ソニー・ホンダモビリティが提供するプロダクト、サービスに対するセキュリティ支援およびセキュリティ基盤の構築

ソニー・ホンダモビリティが提供する製品、サービスにおいて、企画・設計／開発・運用におけるセキュリティ支援、UN-R155,156等セキュリティ関連要件への遵守性確認

【想定ポジション】

リーダークラスまたは担当

【魅力・やりがい】

今までにないモビリティやサービスをサイバーセキュリティという観点で関与し、ステークホルダーに対して安心できるモビリティやサービスを提供することに寄与することができる。

【職場の雰囲気】

活気があるメンバーが多く、人数も少ないため、自由闊達にコミュニケーションが取れます。様々なバックグラウンドを持つ方が集まっており、専門性や個性を出し合って、新しい事業を形にしていこうとする風土があります。

【描けるキャリアパス】

ソフトウェア中心のモビリティプロダクト・サービスに対するサイバーセキュリティ専門性の向上 応募資格 【以下いずれかの知識・経験をお持ちの方】

  • 自動車セキュリティの経験（3年以上）。ISO/SAE21434,UNR155/156の知識を有している

【上記に加え、あれば望ましい経験・スキル】

  • 自動車関連システムの開発経験（3年以上）、CISSP
  • ビジネス英語(TOEIC600点以上)

【求める人物像】以下の想い・適性をお持ちの方

  • 主体性があり、積極的に行動できる方、客観的な視点で分析ができる方。失敗を恐れず、チャレンジを続けていくことができる方。モビリティに熱い思いを持つ方。 待遇 Hondaの福利厚生制度は「自助努力と相互扶助」を原則とし、

安心して生活でき、仕事に集中できる環境をつくることを目的にしており、

社員一人ひとりの多様なライフスタイルを支えています。

■想定年収

450万〜1000万円

※給与は経験・能力を考慮の上決定します。

■福利厚生（受動喫煙防止措置含む）について詳しくは こちら をご覧ください。

title: Linehaul Coordinator - Operations, SPX Express
aboutthejob:
Job Description


  • Địa điểm làm việc: Hà Nội, Bắc Ninh, Hồ Chí Minh
  • Trực tiếp điều phối, lên kế hoạch cho đội xe.
  • Theo dõi tình trạng xe (sửa chữa, theo dõi lịch bảo trì bảo dưỡng, làm việc với bảo hiểm)
  • Xử lý các tình huống phát sinh trong quá trình vận chuyển.
  • Đảm bảo vận hành xuyên suốt cho đội xe.
  • Một số việc khác theo sự phân công của quản lý
  • Check Mail, đối soát thừa thiếu phản hồi CS, xử lý Data.


Requirements


  • Tốt nghiệp Cao đẳng/Đạihọc.
  • Có hiểu biết về E-logistics.
  • Có kinh nghiệm làm việc về bảo hiểm xe và hiểu biết chung về vật lý xe tải.
  • Có kinh nghiệm liên quan công việc Điều phối (ít nhất 06 tháng)

title: Senior iOS Engineer - Consumer Tech
skill: Agile Methodologies, Design Patterns, Functional Programming, Mobile Product Development, Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), Objective-C, Swift (Programming Language), Unit Testing, iOS, and iOS Development
aboutthejob:
We are looking for talents with a keen eye for design for the position of iOS Engineer. The iOS Engineer position is responsible for creating and architecting our iOS applications, maintaining and improving existing features on existing applications, and working with the whole Consumer team to develop innovative solutions that meet our customer’s increasing needs.


If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code and moving forward in your career, then this job is for you. We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design. Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive digital environment for our company, ensuring the greatest experience for our customers.


In more detail, you will:

  • Work with your colleagues (and technical leads) to understand the architecture, specifications and features that we are building
  • Be expected to provide sound solutions to the feature requirements
  • Be expected to maintain our code quality standards
  • Be expected to take ownership of your work and be the main person in charge in developing and maintaining your work. Of course, you will always have the whole team‘s support as we are working as a team, but we are specifically looking for someone who has a high ownership and takes pride in what they do
  • Be expected to be a team player. Our team is composed of individuals of the same blood, if you are hard-core and open-minded, you will find yourself home with us


What Would You Do

  • Maintain and add more user-facing features. You will also need to optimize your codes and applications for maximum speed and scalability
  • Working closely with backend developers to understand data flow and logic, then using that understanding to come up with your front-end solution. We are exclusively using Restful API across all of our services. Knowledge on Restful API is NOT a requirement but it is preferred
  • Follow Agile and DevOps practices like CI/CD to deliver quality code at speed to market
  • Use experimentation and data analysis to tune your applications to be high-performing, intuitive, and functional
  • Research new technologies and best practices, apply and train other team members
  • Innovate, experiment, continuously improve, and learn as you go in an effort to provide simple yet effective solutions to complex problems


What Should You Have

  • 3+ years of full-time engineering experience and working with iOS development
  • Proficiency in Objective-C, Swift
  • Experience with multi-threading & queue process management
  • Experience in app performance optimization and modular architecture is a plus
  • Strong base in OOP, Functional Programming, and Design Patterns
  • Has a solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle
  • Experience and passion for building complex, performance, responsive, accessible, and beautiful mobile native experiences that are well-tested, documented, and monitored
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills. Experience in working with Agile methodology (Scrum or Kanban)
  • Performs effectively & independently in software implementation activities (designing, coding, verification, unit testing, and debugging…)
  • Be able to read and write technical documents in English. Communicating verbally in English is a plus
